intro: Pavetta urundensis, commonly known as the Malabar pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. Pavetta urundensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
